@marcusjaybrode2129
7 hours ago (edited)
Our “trade imbalance” in this case: the USA buys more from Canada than Canada buys from the USA. Many people think this is unfair. They are wrong.
Imagine every American buys one apple from Canada. That’s 350 million apples. If every Canadian buys one apple from USA, that’s only 40 million apples!  Trump thinks this is “unfair”… that it should be “equal”. 
So by that logic, “to be fair” each Canadian must buy 9 apples, which of course is ridiculous.

Our “trade imbalance” in this case: the USA buys more from Canada than Canada buys from the USA. Many people think this is unfair. They are wrong.
Imagine every American buys one apple from Canada. That’s 350 million apples. If every Canadian buys one apple from USA, that’s only 40 million apples!  Trump thinks this is “unfair”… that it should be “equal”. 
So by that logic, “to be fair” each Canadian must buy 9 apples, which of course is ridiculous.
